==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=米11}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ふん]] (fun)
|kanon=[[ふん]] (fun)
|kun=[[くそ]] (kuso), [[ばば]] (baba)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くそ}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|臭い|tr=kusai||stinky, smelly}}, {{m|ja|腐る|tr=kusaru||to rot, to become stinky}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くそ|acc=2|dev=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|屎}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くそ}}

# {{lb|ja|colloquial|sort=くそ}} [[feces]], [[excrement]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|糞っ垂れ|くそったれ}}: [[dingleberry]] {{qualifier|vulgar epithet}}
* {{ja-r|目糞|めくそ}}: [[rheum]], [[eye]] [[mucus]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|糞の役にも立たぬ|くそ の やく に も たたぬ}}: “not even good for '''shit'''” (see {{ja-r|役に立つ|やく に たつ}}: “to be useful, to play a role”)
{{der-bottom}}

====Interjection====
{{ja-pos|interjection|くそ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=くそ|expletive}} [[crap]], [[shit]], [[bullshit]]

=====Usage notes=====
This is not considered as profane as the English glosses. For instance, a child of five using the Japanese interjection ''kuso'' would be unremarkable, whereas it would be very socially inappropriate for a child of five to use the English interjection {{m|en|shit}}.

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|くそ}}

# {{non-gloss definition|A [[derogatory]] prefix.}}
#: {{ja-usex|'''糞'''爺い|'''くそ'''じじい|'''crappy''' old man}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|くそ}}

# [[crappy]], for [[shit]]: {{non-gloss definition|a [[derogatory]] [[emphasis|emphasizing]] suffix.}}
#: {{ja-usex|下手'''糞'''|へた'''くそ'''|'''crappy''' bad at something; to be '''shit''' at doing something}}
#: {{ja-usex|襤褸'''糞'''|ぼろ'''くそ'''|broken down '''for shit''', raggedy-'''ass'''}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ふん}}
{{IPAchar|/pun/}} → {{IPAchar|/fun/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja}} {{m|ltc|糞|tr=pjun<sup>H</sup>}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ふん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふん|フン}}

# animal [[excrement]], [[droppings]]

=====Usage notes=====
This noun specifically refers to the excrement of non-human animals; for human excrement, the term {{m|ja|大便|tr=daiben}} is used.

Due to the complicated nature of this kanji, this word is often written in [[katakana]] instead.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ばば}}
Appears to derive from [[baby talk]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> Compare {{cog|en|poopoo}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ばば|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=2|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|屎}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ばば}}

# {{qualifier|children's word}}: [[poopoo]], [[poop]], [[dookie]]
# {{qualifier|children's word}}: something [[unclean]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|猫糞する|ねこばば する}}: “to do a cat-poo”: to [[sweep something under the rug]]: to hide a problem without actually dealing with it {{qualifier|from how a cat will bury its droppings}}
{{der-bottom}}
